intro: Micropera rostrata, commonly known as the rostrated micropera, is a small, delicate flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae, which includes many ornamental and tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and plant enthusiasts alike.
